etymology.description: 門(門) (mén, 'door') + 䦕(䦕) (guān, 'watchtower') = sound and meaning of barrier or enclosure -> close
etymology.interpretation: The character 關(關) (guān, 'close') combines the image of a door 門(門) (mén, 'door') with a phonetic element 䦕(䦕) (guān, 'watchtower') to convey the idea of closing or securing a passage like a fortress gate.

examples.chinese: 他总是忘记关灯(他總是忘記關燈)，夜晚显得特别黑(夜晚顯得特別黑)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒng shì wàngjì guān dēng, yèwǎn xiǎnde tèbié hēi.
examples.english: He always forgets to turn off the light, so the night appears especially dark.

examples.chinese: 他轻轻关上了窗户(他輕輕關上了窗戶)。
